alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Lewis; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 2:54PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM EST, Radar indicated moderate rain over the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - The rain is transitioning to freezing rain in the area, so flooding beyond typical low lying roadways is not expected at this time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Blue Creek, Mount Olivet, Dover, Germantown, Sardis, Concord, Bradysville, Somo and Orangeburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
